name: Grandma's Waffle Cookies (Pizzelles)
author: Darla O
summary: I could always count on finding these authentic Italian cookies in Grandma's freezer, and her house always smelled yummy! They're great dipped in milk. Grandpa was a blacksmith and actually made their waffle iron, which I still have, although I use my modern electric pizzelle maker when making these.
ingredients: ½ cup butter, melted and cooled
1 teaspoon anise oil, or more to taste
5 cups all-purpose flour, or as needed
directions: Combine eggs, sugar, vegetable oil, butter, and anise oil in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment
Beat until creamy and well combined
Mix in 1 cup flour, baking powder, and salt until combined
Slowly add remaining flour, 1 cup at a time, mixing on low speed until mixture resembles a thick pancake batter
Preheat a pizzelle cooking iron according to manufacturer's instructions
Drop a teaspoon of dough onto each plate of the cooking iron and close the lid
Cook just until steaming slows, 10 to 20 seconds
Repeat with remaining batches of batter
